meanings.definition: A group of servants or attendants.
meanings.sent1: The famuli worked together to clean the house.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy family had a loyal famuli to assist them.
meanings.sent3: The famuli accidentally spilled water while mopping.
meanings.sent4: The famuli were like a well-oiled machine, efficiently completing their tasks.
meanings.sent5: The famuli's dedication to their work was truly admirable.

meanings.definition: A person who serves or attends to another.
meanings.sent1: The kind famuli always made sure the guests were comfortable.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the most reliable famuli in the household.
meanings.sent3: The famuli jokingly pretended to be a royal servant.
meanings.sent4: She was a loyal famuli, always putting others' needs before her own.
meanings.sent5: The famuli's cheerful demeanor brightened everyone's day.

meanings.definition: The servants or attendants of a household or estate.
meanings.sent1: The famuli of the manor were well-trained and efficient.
meanings.sent2: The estate's famuli took care of all the daily chores.
meanings.sent3: The famuli playfully raced each other to finish their tasks first.
meanings.sent4: The famuli were the backbone of the household, ensuring everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The famuli's uniforms were always neat and tidy.
